commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, tasks are not persistent upon exiting Duke.

Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes.
Load the data from the hard disk when Duke starts up.

Dates in Deadline tasks and Event tasks were stored as Strings and
displayed in the same format

Changing to Date objects could allow for customized display of the dates
and even easier comparison between them

commitResults.messageTitle: Changed gitignore to exclude saved tasks
Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of ListCommand and DeadlineTask
Improve code quality by following coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
Add checkstyle to gradle build and made the changes accordingly.
Improve code readability by adding some comments and extra line breaks between
units of logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc header comment for all classes

commitResults.messageBody:
Extend the Task class and also make a new command class for the search
command.

Initially, list command result was also used for search command

Add new search command in place of that

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more JavaDoc header comments for classes and methods
Add JavaFX implementation for GUI in progress
Add GUI to Duke using JavaFX
commitResults.messageBody:
Was using CLI for user interface

Add JavaFX functionality by adding launcher class, GUI component
controllers and respective XML files, and then refactor code to remove
UserInterface class. Transfer Controller class functionality to Duke
class.

Variable name in TaskList may be ambiguous

Rename variable to be more descriptive

Readers may better understand the purpose and context of the variable

Some variables have short abbreviated names without much information.
Some magic strings are present as well.

Let's change the variable names to be fully spelt out and be more
descriptive. Assign magic strings to constants represented by
class-level members.

Readers can get a clearer idea of what each of the variables mean.
Readers can further understand the meaning behind the string constants
used. Future changes may be more convenient as one would only have to
alter the constants, instead of having to change them at all of the
locations they are used at.

Conditionals and try-catch blocks are being used without any assert
statements.

Readers may overlook some necessary assumptions or even question the
absence of handlers for the respective edge cases violating those
assumptions.

Let's add assert statements in relevant parts of the code.

Using assert statements can signal additional information to reader on
the numerous assumptions at the respective parts of the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add increment for more flexibility in searching for items
commitResults.messageBody: Items can be found even if the keyword matches the item only partially
